intro: Lonicera angustifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 2 to 6 feet, featuring slender, arching stems with opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers in clusters, which are usually yellow or orange, followed by red, juicy berries. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for attracting pollinators and supporting local wildlife.
